title: SMC_ReadNCTokens (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SMC_ReadNCTokens
SMC_ReadNCTokens
reads from a
SMC_TokenQueue
of
SMC_Token
and transforms it
into a
SMC_CNC_REF
.

rows.Name: bExecute
rows.Comment: WhileTRUE, the function block is active.

rows:
Pointer on a sufficiently large, free data area (buffer) that is allocated in the IEC application.
It is strongly recommended to allocate the buffer asARRAY[0..x]OF|ioSMC_GCODE_WORD|in order to make sure to have a correct data alignment.
A definition ofARRAY[0..x]OFBYTEmay lead to a misaligned data access on some platforms.
Size of the buffer in byte

Pointer to an object of typeSMC_StringBufferThis object is used to store strings that are defined in the G-code program in order to write them to variables using G36&37.
If the pointer is not set (0) and string constants are used in the G-code program, an error will be generated.(Â´Â´SMC_RNCF_NO_STRINGBUFFERÂ´Â´).

If there arenât variables in the CNC programm, this input
isnât set.SMC_VARLIST
Default velocity for fast forward (G0), FF word
Default acceleration for fast forward (G0), EF+ word

Default deceleration for fast forward (G0), EF- word. A non-
negative value is expected.
If TRUE, an implicit G17 is prepended to the G-code.

Turns on syntax checks that will detect invalid g-code and
stop with an error in this case
TRUEwhile execution of function block is not finished.

TRUEsignals that an error has occurred within
the function block.
